page.title: 06MILE END HOUSE
page.content: {Grid Ref. 0265.7' 0125.8' {Mile End House}was thatched in 1985 by Maynard Westcott and two sons.They work from Chittlehampton.All the old thatch was cleared and burnt.The first layer is tied on as it cannot be nailed.It also makes it easier to bang in the stakes which are made of Hazel wood which is split.The straw is made of wheat (special Wheat). The thatcher uses a special tool to pat down the straw.The special name for Wheat straw is Reed .The tool is called a beater it has diagonal groves in it .A sikle is used to neaten up the loose edges.When the straw is in place the thatcher bangs in the stakes with a wooden mallet .The thatchers are paid 100 pounds a week .Each layer of Reeds is held in place by a rope made of Reeds wound together,held in place with Hazel crooks.
